verses.roman:
sūta uvāca
ity uktvā tam upeyāya
bhagavān sa satāṁ gatiḥ
īśānaḥ sarva-vidyānām
īśvaraḥ sarva-dehinām

synonyms: sūtaḥ uvāca—Sūta Gosvāmī said; iti—thus; uktvā—having said; tam—to the sage; upeyāya—going; bhagavān—the exalted demigod; saḥ—he; satām—of the pure souls; gatiḥ—the shelter; īśānaḥ—the master; sarva-vidyānām—of all branches of knowledge; īśvaraḥ—the controller; sarva-dehinām—of all embodied living beings.
translation: Sūta Gosvāmī said: Having spoken thus, Lord Śaṅkara—the shelter of pure souls, master of all spiritual sciences and controller of all embodied living beings—approached the sage.
